title: One-page PhysioTrack landing + daily check-in scoring UI

requirements.text: Create a single-page website (one route) for the PhysioTrack app that clearly explains what the app does: asks users about their day, generates a health score, and provides tips.

quotes: create a website for my app, PhysioTrack which asks you about your day and gives you a health score based on that, it gives you tips aswell, make one page for the link

acceptanceCriteria: Navigating to the app root shows a single-page layout (no additional pages required to understand/use the site).
The page includes clear sections describing: daily check-in, health score output, and tips guidance.
All user-facing text is in English and references the product name “PhysioTrack”.

requirements.text: Add an interactive “Daily Check-in” section on the same page with a short questionnaire (e.g., sleep, stress, pain/soreness, activity, hydration, mood) and a submit action that calculates and displays a health score (0–100) along with 3–5 actionable tips based on the answers.

quotes: asks you about your day and gives you a health score based on that, it gives you tips aswell

acceptanceCriteria: The user can fill out the daily check-in inputs and submit without leaving the page.
After submit, the UI displays a numeric health score between 0 and 100.
After submit, the UI displays a list of tips that changes based on the user’s answers (not a fixed, always-identical list).
The UI includes a clear way to retake/edit the check-in and recalculate the score.

requirements.text: Establish a coherent, distinctive visual theme for the one-page site (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) and apply it consistently across hero, sections, form, and score/tips output. Avoid a blue/purple-dominant palette.

quotes: create a website for my app, PhysioTrack

acceptanceCriteria: The page uses a consistent design system (buttons, inputs, cards, headings) aligned to one chosen theme.
The primary palette is not blue/purple-dominant.
The layout is responsive and remains usable on mobile and desktop.

requirements.text: Add generated static image assets for the PhysioTrack one-page site and render them on the page (served from frontend/public/assets/generated).

quotes: create a website for my app, PhysioTrack

acceptanceCriteria: All required generated images are present under frontend/public/assets/generated with the exact filenames specified.
The landing page renders the generated images (e.g., hero/brand mark) without fetching them from the backend.

constraints: Frontend: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or any immutable paths listed by the system (compose them instead).
Backend: Keep to a single Motoko actor if backend work becomes necessary; do not introduce additional services or databases.
nonGoals: Persisting user check-ins or scores across sessions (no backend storage required for this request).
Building multiple pages, dashboards, or admin panels beyond the single landing page.

required: PhysioTrack hero illustration featuring a person doing gentle physiotherapy stretches with abstract health/metrics elements (physiotrack-hero.dim_1600x900.png)
Minimal, modern app mark/logo symbol (no text), health/physio inspired (physiotrack-mark.dim_512x512.png)
